title: Pot de Crème
steps: Heat sous vide water bath to 176°F (80°C).
Combine egg yolks, salt, and sugar in a bowl and whisk until smooth.
Add cream to the base and whisk until smooth.
Strain the mixture, then allow to rest for 20 to 30 minutes so that bubbles have time to rise to the top and dissipate. Skim away any remaining bubbles.
Cast 150g of mixture into each wide-mouth canning jar, pouring in a slow, low, steady stream. Pouring too quickly or from too high will cause bubbles.
Place lids on jars and twist until 'fingertip tight' - just barely closed. This allows air to escape during cooking and prevents cracking.
Using canning tongs, carefully transfer jars to sous vide bath, ensuring they are fully submerged. Cook for 1 hour.
Remove jars from bath. Rest at room temperature for 15 minutes before transferring to an ice bath (or just refrigerate). Rapid temperature change can crack the jars.
Once cold, jars will keep sealed in the refrigerator for up to a week.
Serve as is or topped with maple syrup and flake salt.
notes: Similar to crème brûlée but richer and more unctuous - has almost twice the egg yolks.
Cooking sous vide means you can make as many servings as you like with consistent results.
Maple syrup and flake salt is an alarmingly delicious topping combination.
Black lava salt makes a gorgeous color contrast if you have it.
Skip the ice bath if you prefer - just chill in the fridge instead.
To close jars fingertip tight: twist until you feel resistance, then twist back once, then forward once more.
